target_markets.market_description: Consumers who frequently use hospitality services and want personalized experiences
pain_points: having to repeatedly share preferences with each brand
lack of personalized service on first visits
target_markets.market_size_indicators: every brand and restaurant and hotel and airline that consumers come in contact with

target_markets.market_description: Hospitality businesses wanting customer data and personalization
pain_points: inability to provide personalized service to new customers
target_markets.market_size_indicators: everyone in the hospitality sector wants to know more about customers

problems_validated.problem: Brands are trying to extract data consumers don't want to share while consumers have data they do want to share but can't easily
problems_validated.severity: High - affects every consumer-brand interaction in hospitality
problems_validated.current_solutions: Individual brand loyalty programs and profiles
problems_validated.market_gap: No centralized system for consumers to proactively share preferences across all brands

products_tools.name: Consumer Preference API Platform
products_tools.use_case: Central hub for consumer preferences that integrates with hospitality businesses via API
products_tools.pricing: businesses pay to access the hub

business_strategies.strategy: B2B SaaS model where hospitality businesses pay to access consumer preference data via API
business_strategies.implementation: Create API that interacts with all business databases for customer data integration
business_strategies.expected_results: Businesses get valuable customer insights, consumers get personalized experiences
business_strategies.case_study: Like getting the same personalized service you get at a restaurant you've visited 100 times, but on your first visit anywhere

problems_solutions.problem: Consumers have to repeatedly share preferences with each brand and don't get personalized service on first visits
problems_solutions.solution: Create a central consumer profile platform that businesses can access via API
steps: Consumers fill out comprehensive preference profile
Automatic preference sharing when consumer visits participating businesses

startup_ideas.idea: Consumer preference sharing platform for hospitality industry
startup_ideas.target_market: Two-sided: consumers who want personalized experiences and hospitality businesses wanting customer data
startup_ideas.problem_solved: Eliminates need to repeatedly share preferences and enables instant personalization
startup_ideas.business_model: B2B SaaS - businesses pay to access consumer preference data via API
startup_ideas.validation: Start in a given city with local hotels and restaurants

growth_tactics.tactic: Start with businesses in a single city to create network effects
steps: Get hotels and restaurants to integrate
Build consumer base through participating businesses
growth_tactics.results_expected: Network effects as more businesses and consumers join the platform

trends_signals.trend: Consumer desire for data control and proactive sharing rather than passive extraction
trends_signals.opportunity: Build platforms that let consumers control and proactively share their data

trends_signals.trend: Hospitality industry need for customer personalization and preference data
trends_signals.opportunity: Create solutions that provide rich customer preference data to hospitality businesses

actionable_quotes.quote: every brand out there is trying to suck data out of us that we don't necessarily want to have shared and i'm suggesting like let's make a company that gets all the data we do want shared
actionable_quotes.context: Discussing the fundamental insight behind the consumer preference platform idea
actionable_quotes.actionability: Focus on data consumers want to share rather than trying to extract unwanted data

actionable_quotes.quote: everyone wins this is so so okay so well for like i might want to go do this this is brilliant
actionable_quotes.context: Reaction to the consumer preference platform idea
actionable_quotes.actionability: Look for win-win business models where all parties benefit

meta.title: The Next Billion-Dollar SAAS Idea? | Scott Belsky on Where It Happens
